Lorde, New Zealand electropop sensation: 'With 'Virgin,' I wanted to document my femininity'
subhead: Twelve years ago, while still a teenager, the singer rose to fame with her hit song 'Royals.' Quickly endorsed by some of the biggest names in music, the 28-year-old's unique voice and bold songwriting were a departure from music industry standards. She has just released her raw fourth album, 'Virgin,' and will perform at the Zénith in Paris on November 10.

Israel says remains of hostage returned from Gaza identified
subhead: Idan Shtivi was 28 when he was killed on October 7, 2023, at the Nova music festival. He was attending as a photographer when the event was attacked by Hamas-led militants. On Friday, the Israeli military said that it had recovered the body of Ilan Weiss and the remains of a second hostage whose name was not initially released until Saturday.

headline: French youth fund summer holidays in Marseille through 'narcotourism'
subhead: Young people visiting the southern French city for holidays and finding themselves short on cash or accommodation sometimes end up offering their services as lookouts or dealers at drug-selling spots.

headline: Three erotic experiences inspired by group activities
subhead: Maïa Mazaurette is on a mission to spice up your steamy summer nights. This week, she explores how to mingle your fantasies with those of others, through erotic literature, nude drawing, or at a libertine club.

headline: How Republicans and Democrats are redrawing US congressional maps to their advantage
subhead: The battle over redistricting is intensifying in the US ahead of the crucial November 2026 midterm elections, with maneuvers from Texas to California likely to shape the outcome.

Mohammed Hilles' first days in France after arriving from Gaza: 'I went to a baroque concert at the Philharmonie. It filled me with joy, sadness and nostalgia'
subhead: Hilles, 25, left Gaza to study music at Paris-Saclay University. After the initial relief of his arrival, he has grown increasingly worried about his family in the Palestinian enclave.

headline: Air quality in Paris: Monitoring agency reports significant improvement over 10 years
subhead: According to Airparif, the independent body monitoring air quality in the Paris region, policies have had a 'significant and measurable impact.'

headline: Ultra-processed foods cause negative health effects within weeks, study finds
subhead: In a clinical trial similar to those used for testing medicines, scientists studied the health impacts of a diet filled with ultra-processed foods. Results show that numerous biological processes are affected.
